title: It's time to revisit why Kench cannot devour a buff after three attacks like he can champions
body:
3 attacks will ensure he cannot cheese the other jungler's buffs with devour. This is the one thing stopping him from being an ok jungler. Let him be free.

Update: Riot has stated that they like his jungling right where it is now because it is in an ok state already. I'm so sorry everyone. I failed you. You trusted me, and I failed you.

replies.body:
Volibear can do the same thing with his smite + bite. Tahm Kench wouldn't even be that great at invading because he is really slow.

I don't know why they imposed this restriction on him, there are no good reasons.
No, but Tahm can Q+W over the wall to flip off the opponent by resetting the buff.

He cant qw over the wall because thats only one stack.
He needs to have 2 stacks ready which would require him to be on the same side as buff. If he wanted a chance to steal it

No, he just applies 3 stacks while zoning the opponent off and then just resets the buff. He can go through the wall or through the bush, but being able to reset the blue/red buff is horrible for the enemy laner.
What are you talking about??
Agreed. He should elaborate

He attacks the buff 3 times, and either drags the buff to the bush with him, or it follows the opponent.

From there, he swallows it. QW if RIot allows it, or just straight up W. Because the "Patience" of the monster is already lowered enough as is from switching targets between Tahm and the jungler he's invading, when he swallows it, the buff will likely be reset with its Patience down to 0. If not, he spits it too far away from the spawn camp, and the buff resets.

I wrote enemy laner instead of enemy jungler*
Okay but what the enemy jungle loses in the 5 seconds of tahm screwing around, tahm loses so much more and risks being killed. Your scenario really doesn't make sense as an argument against it.

True, mb.

It can be used as counter-invades too
Yeah but then tahm would be lsing xp, gold as well. He would have to pay and risk himslef to do that. Also blitz gets to do that more reliably and faster now

> [{quoted}](name=KoKoboto,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AYUihrQy,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-06-09T04:04:22.603+0000)
>
> Volibear can do the same thing with his smite + bite. Tahm Kench wouldn't even be that great at invading because he is really slow.
> 
> I don't know why they imposed this restriction on him, there are no good reasons.

Not really the same because Tahm could take off and run with the buff. Similar, but not the same.
Tahm has reduced movement speed when he devoures enemy units... so wouldn't really call it running
Tahm has reduced movement speed when devouring an enemy champion.
Then use it on buffs too, what's the problem?
His ult into a bush would be effective if the enemy over extended
His ult is unique and always works regardless of what position he is playing.

Not all the time.
It's similar to a ryze ult where it's windows of power are very small and specific that you may not get optimal use out of it for possibly the entire game
As long as it's off CD it always has a use. Getting to lane early or moving across the map are simple things but are still optimal.

Actually it is interesting because Voli would be in the same spot because he can't bite without  building up frenzy with a couple of autos. But as you said, nobody has ever accused Voli of being a cheese counterjungler.

This would make his jungle crazy strong. He's an okay jungler right now, and we'd like to leave it there. If we make him a really powerful jungler, we would likely have to make some compensatory nerfs. This would leave him weaker than he is right now in top and support. We think he's best as a support, so that would be a bad thing.

> [{quoted}](name=ZenonTheStoic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AYUihrQy,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2017-06-09T19:12:15.800+0000)
>
> This would make his jungle crazy strong. He's an okay jungler right now, and we'd like to leave it there. If we make him a really powerful jungler, we would likely have to make some compensatory nerfs. This would leave him weaker than he is right now in top and support. We think he's best as a support, so that would be a bad thing.

Not sure why the best method of balancing tanks in the jungle is making them take forever to clear it. Just not fun for the tank player.

> [{quoted}](name=The Yetii Rider,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AYUihrQy,comment-id=00120002,timestamp=2017-06-09T19:22:38.130+0000)
>
> Not sure why the best method of balancing tanks in the jungle is making them take forever to clear it. Just not fun for the tank player.

There's a whole bunch of levers we have to balance tanks in the jungle. Clear speed is only one of them. OP is coming at this problem from a solution-first perspective though, without defining well what the goal is and what the intended change is. If your goal is just "make TK a better jg", there's a bunch of things you can do and it's not obvious to me why letting him devour buff monsters is the best way to execute on the goal. And like I said, whenever you consider changes to move toward a certain goal, you have to consider their unintended consequences. In this case, he's in a great place support, so any change that runs the risk of requiring nerfs after the fact harms a much more valuable state of things, namely that he's in a good place for his most played role.

have you considered just letting his passive stack on monsters? 
it would only increase his clear speed a little and would let him use his stun to cut down on the damage he takes early.

This. Tahm is not a strong jungler anymore. He's not even OK. He just sucks in the jungle now. He was/is not an unhealthy kit for jungling, he just has some arbitrary weaknesses that are shutting it down.

1. Let his passive stack on EVERYTHING for damage if nothing else.
2. Let him stun non-epic monsters with his full-stack Q.
3. Let him devour non-epic monsters with his full-stack W. If you are worried about clear times or something, then make it do 50% damage vs large monsters or something. It can be tweaked to allow for healthy jungle play without touching the rest of his kit AT ALL.
But, on the topic of taking buffs, why can Syndra still do it if TK can't? She's not even a jg!

> [{quoted}](name=ZenonTheStoic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AYUihrQy,comment-id=001200020000,timestamp=2017-06-09T20:07:49.674+0000)
>
> There's a whole bunch of levers we have to balance tanks in the jungle. Clear speed is only one of them. OP is coming at this problem from a solution-first perspective though, without defining well what the goal is and what the intended change is. If your goal is just "make TK a better jg", there's a bunch of things you can do and it's not obvious to me why letting him devour buff monsters is the best way to execute on the goal. And like I said, whenever you consider changes to move toward a certain goal, you have to consider their unintended consequences. In this case, he's in a great place support, so any change that runs the risk of requiring nerfs after the fact harms a much more valuable state of things, namely that he's in a good place for his most played role.

Clear speed IS a lever you choose to use, though. And all that does is force tank players to spend more time PVEing than other players and other roles. It's a BAD lever, because it sacrifices excitement and enjoyment playing the game for a menial repetitive chore.

Technically the issue is approached many ways, not only solution first.

An example of problem-first is mentioning the disparity between Syndra W and Kench W. The lack of equality between the two effects that are otherwise similar ability irks some players.

> [{quoted}](name=ZenonTheStoic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AYUihrQy,comment-id=001200020000,timestamp=2017-06-09T20:07:49.674+0000)
>
> He's an okay jungler right now
>
> he's in a great place support

Jungler: Less than 45% win rate and 0.1% pick rate.
Support: Less than 48% win rate and 3% pick rate.

That's not "okay". That's not "great".
Maybe the goal is consistency in expectations. {{champion:134}}

What if your goal is "making abilities that work consistently across characters". Blitz and Syndra get to pull buffs with no condition attached to them. Capping the max damage against epic monsters on Tahms W so that is fair while conditioning to have 3 stacks would be a good way to do this since he could not just steal a buff put of the blue. Mind you Blitz can already steal buffs from the support roll, and if you condition Tahm to have 3 stacks on buff before devour then he would be putting himself at risk just to be a little annoying to the enemy jungler, and deprive himself from his main source of damage while doing so
Thought he was intended as a top laner?

In early development, when he was still called "fish tank", they wanted to create a tank for the top lane.
But that was before they determined his kit. Afterwards, it was pretty obvious that his devour would have huge potential in the support role.

That was when his intended primary role shifted from top to support.
At least that's what I recall.

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AYUihrQy,comment-id=00120003,timestamp=2017-06-09T19:23:03.319+0000)
>
> Thought he was intended as a top laner?

We pivoted half-way through development from top lane to support with a top secondary. When we allowed W to eat allies it just made a lot more sense to have him lane with an ally. So the intention is support first, top secondary, and that's pretty much what we're seeing.

Slightly OT, but can you please remove the ally-targeting prioritisation from his W? It feels horrible for TK players, because it heavily limits their agency.
For example, if they try to devour an enemy champion really close to one of their allies, most of the times the game automatically targets the ally instead, but this could be counterproductive for them, so they're forced to refrain themselves from using the spell altogether.
Has there been any internal testing for this buff? Just wondering.

I think there was in the beginning.
If this was the conclusion then, the same stands now.

He's been nerfed considerably compared to his release state.

That said, I'm not convinced it would make him too strong. At least not with {{champion:427}} existing.

"he's not a jungler so there's no reason for Riot to buff him"

Well considering he's a pretty shitty top laner and an extremely niche support, I'd be 100% down to shift him to the jungle. Jungle Tahm makes sense, and the jungle needs a strong tank jungler not named Zac anyways.

He's not that bad in top.

He can be a quite effective counterpick, surprisingly.
Same with Braum. Braum top can be surprisingly scary.
same reason why syndra cant pick buffs up with a simple button... oh wait
Ah yes, Syndra Jungle, my favorite position.
What? That would be broken as hell. Kench already does massive damage to jungle creeps. Letting him Devour buffs would be stupid.

> [{quoted}](name=Stardust Ray,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AYUihrQy,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-06-09T03:52:20.852+0000)
>
> What? That would be broken as hell. Kench already does massive damage to jungle creeps. Letting him Devour buffs would be stupid.

Not really. His passive damage doesn't even apply to monsters _(AFAIK it only works on champions)_.

That leaves him with only two damaging abilities, one of which is single target.

> [{quoted}](name=Stardust Ray,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AYUihrQy,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-06-09T03:52:20.852+0000)
>
> What? That would be broken as hell. Kench already does massive damage to jungle creeps. Letting him Devour buffs would be stupid.

Massive damage? Are we thinking of the same catfish?

Honestly I don't understand why he isn't allowed to be a jungler. He's slow as fuck and his biggest strengths were lost in the jungle, even before the nerf that made his ultimate passive not work on monsters. His Q and W poke along with his E shield + health return actually made him a pretty good laner. Jungling was never really an issue for his balancing. 

So even before the nerfs his jungling wasn't an issue, but he lost his %own health damage on camps and the ability to damage buffs by spitting small monsters on them because he can't devourer the large monster.

I don't think it is like they want to strictly forbid Tahm Kench to be a jungler.
But he was designed to be a support and top laner.

So why should they put work into making a champion viable in a position he was never really intended for?
Imagine everyone would do that.
Boards would be flooded with request like
"I want this change to make Jinx a viable top laner!"
"We should work on this stuff so Udyr is able to go bot lane!"

A champion doesn't have to be viable in every position.
You can play the champ in every position you want, but you can't expect Riot to make changes just so your champ becomes viable everywhere you want to play him.

But we're not asking for the **introduction of a new feature**, we're asking for **the removal of a limitation**. "Tahm can't devour buffs" is an exception purposefully made by riot in order to keep the kench out of the jungle.

Well one of the major comparisons is how Syndra can pick the buffs up with her W, and unlike a lot of board comparisons, it does make some sense; there's no reason Syndra should be able to move a buff with W and Tahm shouldn't be able to do the same.

Correct me if I'm wrong, but a monster grabbed by Syndra is still targetable, is it not?

There exists no such thing with Tahm.
